meanings.sent1: I can drive the car to the store.
meanings.sent2: She learned to drive when she was sixteen.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to drive the toy car.
meanings.sent4: His passion for cars drives him to learn more about engines.
meanings.sent5: The children pretended to drive a spaceship to the moon.

meanings.definition: A strong natural or instinctive desire or impulse
meanings.sent1: His drive to succeed is admirable.
meanings.sent2: The hunger drive in animals is powerful.
meanings.sent3: The drive to eat cake is strong after dinner.
meanings.sent4: Her drive for perfection pushes her to work hard.
meanings.sent5: The drive to explore new places is exciting.

meanings.definition: A trip or journey in a vehicle
meanings.sent1: We went on a long drive to the beach.
meanings.sent2: The scenic drive through the mountains was breathtaking.
meanings.sent3: The drive to the airport was smooth and quick.
meanings.sent4: The drive to the countryside was a refreshing escape.
meanings.sent5: The family enjoyed a leisurely drive in the countryside.

meanings.definition: To force or compel someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The coach will drive the team to practice harder.
meanings.sent2: Peer pressure can drive individuals to make poor choices.
meanings.sent3: The teacher will drive the students to complete their homework.
meanings.sent4: His determination will drive him to achieve his goals.
meanings.sent5: The motivation to succeed will drive her to work diligently.

meanings.sent1: Her drive to finish the project was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The team showed great drive in winning the championship.
meanings.sent3: The drive to clean the house was suddenly gone.
meanings.sent4: His drive to help others is truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The drive to excel in academics led to her success.
